sanger.argml.graph.model
Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
  sanger.argml.graph.model.Vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Vertex>, java.lang.Iterable<Edge>
public class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Vertex>, java.lang.Iterable<Edge>

An implementation of an acestral recombination graph vertex. Vertices are multi furcated and have an implicit active region derived from the active regions of the edges that go through them. The sum of all active regions on edges coming in and of those going out should be identical and is, in fact, the flux going through the vertex.

Author:
Lior Galanti

Method Detail

split

public Vertex split(int id,
                    int position)
Creates a new vertex and transferes all activity on positions bigger than position to it. New vertex will have copies of all the outgoing edges with activity in positions bigger than position. Edges coming out of the original vertex will be active only on positions smaller or equal to position. Mutations are devided between the two so that they remain on an edge active in their position.

Parameters:
id - Id for the new vertex.
position - Position to split the active regions.
Returns:
The new vertex.

merge

public Vertex merge(int id,
                    Vertex other)
Merge other vertex into this one. All edges pointing at or from other are redirected to this vertex, this vertex's id is set to id and other is removed from the genealogy.

Parameters:
id - New id for this vertex after the merge is complete.
other - Vertex to merge into this vertex.
Returns:
this to facilitate chaining.

createAncestor

public Edge createAncestor(int id)
Construct a new vertex and connect it to this vertex as an ancestor. A new Edge is also created with the new vertex as a source and this vertex as target. The new edge will have the full active region of this vertex.

Parameters:
id - Id for the new Vertex.
Returns:
The new vertex.

createAncestor

public Edge createAncestor(int id,
                           NaturalSet region)
Construct a new vertex and connect it to this vertex as an ancestor. A new Edge is also created with the new vertex as a source and this vertex as target. The new edge will have a region active region.

Parameters:
id - Id for the new Vertex.
region - active region for the edge from the ancestor.
Returns:
The new vertex.

connectToAncestor

public void connectToAncestor(Vertex ancestor)
Connect ancestor to this vertex. The new edge will point at this vertex as a target and at ancestor as a source. The new edge will have the full active region of this vertex.

Parameters:
ancestor - Vertex to connect to.

isDegenerate

public boolean isDegenerate(NaturalSet region)
                     throws NaturalSetException
The vertex has only 1 incoming and 1 outgoing Edge active on region.

Parameters:
region -
Returns:
True if (inDegree(region) == 1 && outDegree(region) == 1) evaluates to true.
Throws:
NaturalSetException - if region is not defined over the same NaturalDomain as the host Genealogy.

public boolean isGmrca()
The vertex is the grand most recent common ancestor.

Returns:
True if the vertex is the gmrca.

public boolean isLeaf()
The vertex is a leaf node. The leaf nodes are the sequences in the present time.

Returns:
True if the vertex is a leaf node.

inActiveRegion

public NaturalSet inActiveRegion()
Union the active regions on all incoming edges. This is defined as the vertex's incoming active region and under valid conditions should be equal to outActiveRegion(). The method returns a new instance so changes to it will not effect the vertex.

Returns:
The union of active regions of all the vertex's incoming edges.

outActiveRegion

public NaturalSet outActiveRegion()
Union the active regions on all outgoing edges. This is defined as the vertex's active region and under valid conditions should be equal to inActiveRegion(). The method returns a new instance so changes to it will not effect the vertex.

Returns:
The union of active regions of all the vertex's outgoing edges.

mutations

public NaturalSet mutations(NaturalSet region)
                     throws NaturalSetException
Trace all mutation events on the lineage leading to this vertex from the GMRCA. The returned value indicates which snp locations have mutated since the GMRCA. For the actual sequence at this vertex see haplotype(NaturalSet).

Parameters:
region - Active region on which to test for possible mutation events.
Returns:
All snp positions that had mutation events.
Throws:
NaturalSetException - if region is not defined over the same NaturalDomain as the host Genealogy.

Returns:
All snp positions that had mutation events.
Throws:
NaturalSetException - if region is not defined over the same NaturalDomain as the host Genealogy.
